Module LabAssignment
Package filter

Class CompositeFilter<T>

java.lang.Object
filter.CompositeFilter<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of object being filtered.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Filter<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
CareerCentreStaffFilter, CompanyRepFilter, StudentFilter
public abstract class CompositeFilter<T> extends Object implements Filter<T>
An abstract implementation of the Filter interface that aggregates multiple filters. This class uses "AND" logic: an item must satisfy all added filters to match. Subclasses should implement setDefaultFilters() to define their specific baseline criteria.

  • Constructor Details

    • CompositeFilter

      public CompositeFilter()
      Constructs a new CompositeFilter. Initializes an empty list of filters.

  • Method Details

    • addFilter

      public void addFilter(Filter<T> f)
      Adds a new filter criteria to the composition. The new filter will be included in subsequent matches(Object) checks.
      Parameters:
      f - The filter to add.

    • removeFilter

      public void removeFilter(Filter<T> f)
      Removes a specific filter criteria from the composition.
      Parameters:
      f - The filter to remove.

    • matches

      public boolean matches(T item)
      Checks if the item satisfies all registered filters.
      Specified by:
      matches in interface Filter<T>
      Parameters:
      item - The object to check.
      Returns:
      true if the item matches every filter in the list; false if it fails any single filter.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Resets the filter list to its default state. This clears all manually added filters and re-applies the rules defined in setDefaultFilters().
      Specified by:
      clear in interface Filter<T>
